CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 25, 1953, page 3, reads: "Women Take Over Woodworking Class at Iks - When the Irene Kaufmann Settlement opened its Woodworking Hobby Class several months ago for the purpose of encouraging and instructing Hill District families in the art of repairing and making small articles of furniture for the home, it was never dreamed that women and children would be the principle persons to take part in it. However, that is exactly what happened. Shown in various stages of making or repairing furniture at the sessions held on Wednesday nights are, far left photo, left to right: Ethel Coppman, Lenore Rainey, Wanda Jackson, Nedra Banner and Jack Nathan, instructor. Middle photo: Julia Willis, Margaret Black, Nedra Banner and Marian Charles. Right photo: William Robinson, Margaret Friday, Sophronia Warmack and LaVaughn Williams. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Julia Willis, Margaret Black, Nedra Banner, and Marian Charles and man, possibly Jack Nathan, gathered around workbench with hand tools, wood, and book titled "Book & Magazine Rack," in woodwork workshop with lockers, power tools, ladder, sign that reads "Please Leave This Room As You Find It - Thanks" at the Irene Kaufmann Settlement
